channel.title: Woodcutting
channel.description: If an player spam clicking in any tree he will get full bag of logs, Anyone knows how i can fix this bug? *If it's needed to post my woodcutting class, tell me and i will post it here.

item.title: Woodcutting
item.dc:creator: @magekitten magekitten
item.description:
@magekitten wrote:

[quote=“Naseem, post:7, topic:473236”][quote author=magekitten link=topic=591161.msg4180747#msg4180747 date=1355500381]
http://www.rune-server.org/runescape-development/google/tutorials/279899-cycle-based-events-handler.html
[/quote]

Thank you very much

I just have more one question, if you dont mind answering it

I have two class’s about tasks called: TaskScheduler and Task, Do you know what these for? :P[/quote]

I don’t remember exactly what they’re for, but keep them there.

Read full topic

item.title: Woodcutting
item.dc:creator: @Naseem Naseem
item.description:
@Naseem wrote:

owns reece:

add delays what revision you using?

InsanityX

[quote=“magekitten, post:3, topic:473236”]I’m assuming you’re using PI, so you probably have a cycle based event handler. Make it to when the player clicks on the tree that it creates a new event with a timer

something like this should work.

[code]CycleEventHandler.getSingleton().addEvent(c, new CycleEvent() {
@Override
public void execute(CycleEventContainer container) {
if (c.isWoodcutting == true) {
if (c.woodcuttingTimer > 0) {
c.woodcuttingTimer–;
} else if (c.woodcuttingTimer == 0) {
//woodcutting stoof here
c.isWoodcutting = false;
}
} else if (c.isWoodcutting == false) {
container.stop();
}
}
@Override
public void stop() {

             }
  }, 3);[/code][/quote]

Unfortunately InsanityX doesn’t have cycle based event handler,
If i should add this cycle event handler can you give me a link for a tut?

Read full topic

public void execute(CycleEventContainer container) {
if (c.isWoodcutting == true) {

c.woodcuttingTimer–;
} else if (c.woodcuttingTimer == 0) {
//woodcutting stoof here
c.isWoodcutting = false;
}
} else if (c.isWoodcutting == false) {
container.stop();
